qas.question: How did Lothar Wolfgang Nordheim describe von Neumann?
What did Jacob Bronowski think of von Neumann?

answers.text: He was the cleverest man I ever knew, without exception. He was a genius.

qas.question: What did Lecturer Polya think about von Nuemann?

answers.text: Johnny was the only student I was ever afraid of.

context: Lothar Wolfgang Nordheim described von Neumann as the <a0_0>"fastest mind I ever met",<a0_0/> and Jacob Bronowski wrote "<a1_0>He was the cleverest man I ever knew, without exception. He was a genius.<a1_0/>" George Pólya, whose lectures at ETH Zürich von Neumann attended as a student, said "<a2_0>Johnny was the only student I was ever afraid of.<a2_0/> If in the course of a lecture I stated an unsolved problem, the chances were he'd come to me at the end of the lecture with the complete solution scribbled on a slip of paper." Halmos recounts a story told by Nicholas Metropolis, concerning the speed of von Neumann's calculations, when somebody asked von Neumann to solve the famous fly puzzle:
